intro: Erica austronyassana, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreen plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops. Erica austronyassana is well adapted to harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
